meta_description: The University of Chicago's art museum. Free and open to the public.
hours_text:
# Visit

Winter 2026

**The Smart is now open with our fall-winter exhibitions Tues. - Sun. 10 am - 4:30 pm.** Please join us for [Theaster Gates: Unto Thee](https://smartmuseum.uchicago.edu/exhibitions/theaster-gates-unto-thee/), alongside [Smart to the Core: Wise to Power](https://smartmuseum.uchicago.edu/exhibitions/smart-to-the-core-wise-to-power/). Admission is always free and open to the public.

### Questions?

Contact our visitor services team at 773.702.0200 or [smart-museum@uchicago.edu](mailto:smart-museum@uchicago.edu).

* * *

## Always free

Thanks to the support of our [SmartPartners](https://smartmuseum.uchicago.edu/support/smartpartners/), admission to the Smart is always free and all are welcome to visit.

* * *

## Regular Hours

**Monday** Museum closed  
**Tuesday** 10 am – 4:30 pm  
**Wednesday** 10 am – 4:30 pm  
**Thursday** 10 am – 4:30 pm  
**Friday** 10 am – 4:30 pm  
**Saturday** 10 am – 4:30 pm  
**Sunday** 10 am – 4:30 pm 

_*These hours are subject to museum closures for university-recognized holidays, installation closures between exhibitions, and a winter recess. Check our homepage and Google business hours for the most up-to-date information._

### **UPCOMING EXCEPTIONS**

_Wednesday, December 24th - Thursday, January 1st:_**CLOSED**

* * *

## Group visits

**University class visits**  
The Museum welcomes University of Chicago class visits and individual research appointments to its exhibitions and study room. Reservations should coordinate...

accessibility_text:
# Accessibility at UChicago

The University of Chicago is committed to providing an environment that is accessible for all individuals, including people with disabilities.

For websites and digital content, we strive to comply with Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG), as outlined in the UChicago [Digital Accessibility Policy](https://intranet.uchicago.edu/policies/information-technology-policies/digital-accessibility-policy) and [Digital Accessibility Standards](https://websites.uchicago.edu/policies-standards/web-properties/#accessibility). We continually work to improve access.

To provide feedback regarding the digital accessibility of University content, please [contact the Center for Digital Accessibility](https://digitalaccessibility.uchicago.edu/about/contact-us/) or report a barrier using the Digital Accessibility Barrier link below.

## Access UChicago Now

Access UChicago Now (AUN) is a coalition of University units, divisions, and schools that provides leadership and transparency regarding accessibility for the campus community. AUN works to empower units, divisions, and schools to make University education, research, work, events, and other programs and services that are a part of University life accessible to members of the campus community of differing abilities. AUN engages in this work by gathering information from campus partners and members of the campus community and then synthesizing this information to inform current priorities, which are set and ...

Free and open to the public

Search:

Search

  * ## [Art in Public Spaces](https://publicart.uchicago.edu/)

From unexpected sculptures to temporary commissions, public art makes the University of Chicago a unique destination. [Explore public art on campus »](https://publicart.uchicago.edu/)

  * ## [UChicago Class Engagements](/feitler-center-for-academic-inquiry/teaching-at-the-smart/)

Staff at the Feitler Center are available to support teaching and research at the University of Chicago. [Start a conversation with us »](https://smartmuseum.uchicago.edu/feitler-center-for-academic-inquiry/)

  * ## [Explore the collection](http://smartcollection.uchicago.edu/collections)

The objects in our collection support academic and artistic study, inspire new ideas, and foster reflection and conversation by our diverse audiences. [Explore the collection online »](http://smartcollection.uchicago.edu/collections)
